summary: This is an email from a SigNet Technologies Federal Sales Representative to an unspecified recipient at MCC New York, detailing the technical plan for installing and cutting over to new video recording hardware at the facility. The email focuses on logistical steps like unboxing equipment, needing power/network connections, and coordinating with a technician named Houston.

persons.name: Houston
persons.context: Mentioned as a SigNet technician who will be on site Monday to assist with the equipment installation and will be sending NCIC forms.

events.title: SigNet technician on-site at MCC New York
events.description: A SigNet technician named Houston is scheduled to be on site at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York to assist with the installation of new video recording hardware.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
Beltsville, MD 20705 (SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions office address)
keyFacts: The email details a technical upgrade plan for video recording systems at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The work involves replacing old recording hardware with new equipment, requiring coordination for power, network, and physical cable connections.
A SigNet technician named Houston is scheduled to be on site the following Monday (August 12, 2019) to assist with the installation.
The sender is a Federal Sales Representative for SigNet Technologies, which is part of Convergint Federal Solutions.

The email is dated August 11, 2019, which is the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death in MCC New York custody on August 10, 2019, suggesting it relates to facility maintenance or upgrades around that time.
